chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial Scheduling Order

No violent or disorderly contact with S.P. (age 6) and S.P. (age 1) and only if authorized by CPS.  Must be in residence from 6 pm to 6 am unless at work or going to and from work.   Court orders Level 4  supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:50 PM Defendant Patrick E. Page in court by video with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A.L. appeared by video. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense requests bond modification. Court grants modification to conditions: No violent or disorderly contact with S.P. (age 6) and S.P. (age 1) and only if authorized by CPS.  Must be in residence from 6 pm to 6 am unless at work or going to and from work.   Court orders Level 4  supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Bond continued.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
